result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas J. Pennau

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned)-tpg

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 13CF-159 and 14CF-61 - Both Cases Called @ 2:12 PM: Defendant Nicholas J. Pennau in court with attorney Erik C Johnson.  Scott Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim A.P. also in court appearing via telephone.  Per DA:  Joint Resolution recited by Atty Blader with argument expected as to Expungement request.  Def and counsel concur w/recital.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Victim states for the record that she will not be making a statement.  Plea Ct Nos. 2, 3 and 4 of INFO:  NC   Court accepts pleas and enters JOC.   13CF-159 Ct 1 DRI and 14CF-61 DRI.  Argument by DA Blader - matter not appropriate for expungement.  Argument by Atty Johnson as to expungement request.  Statement by Def:  Yes - apologizes to victim.  Statement by Victim to Def.  The Court:  13CF-159 - Ct Nos 2, 3 and 4:  S/W - 30 mos Probation (max 36 mos) - concurrent terms.  Conditions:  Ct 2 only: 50 days WCJ, Huber, TS of 3 days, No GT, Report: 9/15/14 @ 8:00 pm.  As to all Counts:  AODA and any follow thru; Ab Sobriety; Bar Prohibition; The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; DAAP program completion and any other treatment deemed appropriate; Court Costs as to all 3 charges - Bond to be applied - 60 DTP any Bal or PP; orders destruction of short barrel shot gun as per 968.20 - to be provided to State Crime Lab for destruction; Court will not allow expungement.  Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 2, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Nicholas J. Pennau
Current: PO Box 1031, Wautoma, WI 54982-1031 United States  (Effective: 05-23-2014)
Prior: 139 W. Mount Morris Avenue, Wautoma, WI 54982
Petition for Leave to FIle Additional Motions
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 2, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant is prohibited from going on the premises of any bars. Defendant not to possess any dangerous weapons, including but not limited to any firearms.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 13CF-159 and 14CF-61 - Both Cases Called @ 3:00 PM: Defendant Nicholas J. Pennau in court with attorney Erik C Johnson.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    14CF-61:  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Atty Johnson requests Jury Trial be cleared from the calendar as to 13CF-159.  Court entertains waiver of time limits for pre-lim hearing.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of 20 day time limit for pre-lim.  P/S Scheduled as to both cases.  ADA argues for Signature Bond on new matter.  No objection by defense counsel.  Signature Bond ordered which should mirror all conditions as ordered in 13CF-159.  Jury Trial currently scheduled for 7/2/14 and 7/3/14 is now cancelled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 10:00 am.
